summary: This document is a feedback questionnaire for the Wikimedia Conference 2018. It invites participants to complete an online survey and provides a detailed set of background, content, program, networking, organizational, and overall evaluation questions. It includes Likert-scale matrices, open text fields, and conditional (filter) questions. It also states that responses are optional and will be published only in aggregated form.
intended_task: Collect post-conference feedback from attendees to evaluate and improve future Wikimedia conferences.
sub_tasks: Route users to the survey via link or URL and capture responses
Measure satisfaction, outcomes, networking, and logistics via Likert items and open responses

related_elements.content_preview: Or copy and paste the URL below into your internet browser:

sensitive_elements.content_preview: Accommodation at the Mercure hotel (if applicable)

related_elements.content_preview: Support from the WMCON travel team/travel agency (if applicable)

injectable_regions.description: Whitespace near page numbers can hide small/invisible text or tracking beacons without visual change.
Large gaps between the intro paragraphs and the disclaimer allow hidden text or overlayed links.
Wide left/right margins can contain off-canvas text that OCR/VLM may read but humans won’t notice.

render_parse_gaps.description: Zero‑width spaces (\u200b) are embedded in multiple lines; byte/OCR parsers may see different tokens than readers.
Likert bullets (○ ●) and column headers may misalign, causing misread scales or inverted answers.

redactable_targets.content_preview: All responses are optional; aggregated results only.
redactable_targets.impact: Removing this changes perceived consent/privacy, coercing participation.
Redaction or replacement can reroute users to a phishing or fake survey.

redactable_targets.content_preview: Communication regarding the program design process...
redactable_targets.impact: Hiding quality criteria skews evaluation of conference organization.

images.content_description: Repeated logo or decorative header element.
Decorative graphic (likely the same conference logo).

downstream_consumers.vulnerability_notes: Zero‑width spaces and bullet glyphs can distort list parsing and scale labels.
Injected margin/footer text may be captured by OCR though visually unnoticed.
Decorative logos irrelevant; may overweigh branding; Likert layout may be misread.
Hidden unicode and injected whitespace text can poison keyword indexing.

risk_profile.domain_specific_risks: Attackers could replace the survey link with a phishing URL, alter privacy disclaimers, or inject hidden text that skews automated analyses of attendee feedback.
